intro: Neomammillaria napina, commonly known as the napina cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is a small, globular cactus with a short stem and a dense covering of spines. The plant typically produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are modified into spines, and it has a shallow root system adapted to dry conditions. Neomammillaria napina is prized for its compact size and ornamental value in succulent collections.
